raw_text:
Man Utd through after Exeter test
 
 Manchester United avoided an FA Cup upset by edging past Exeter City in their third round replay.
 
 Cristiano Ronaldo scored the opener, slipping the ball between Paul Jones' legs after just nine minutes. United wasted a host of chances to make it safe as Jones made some great saves, but Wayne Rooney put the tie beyond doubt late on with a cool finish. Exeter had chances of their own, Sean Devine twice volleying wide and Andrew Taylor forcing Tim Howard to save. United boss Sir Alex Ferguson was taking few chances after their 0-0 draw in the first game and he handed starts to Paul Scholes and Ryan as well as Ronaldo and Rooney. Exeter began brightly with Devine and Steve Flack seeing plenty of the ball, but it did not take United long to assert their authority and the hosts soon found themselves a goal down. Scholes played a lovely pass in to Ronaldo on the left-hand side of the six-yard box and the Portuguese winger slid the ball between the legs of Jones to open the scoring.
 
 United sensed a chance to finish the tie as a contest early on and Ronaldo blazed over before Jones saved well from Scholes and then Rooney. The visitors' pressure by now was incessant and Rooney had another shot blocked while Ronaldo slammed well over the bar again from a good position. Just before the break Giggs had a golden chance to double the advantage, but the Welshman dragged a left-foot effort badly wide from 10 yards. In stoppage time Exeter created their best chance as Alex Jeannin swung in a cross from the left that Devine managed to flick goalwards, but the ball flew wide of Howard's goal. The Grecians came out after the break in determined fashion and Howard had to show safe hands to collect two searching crosses into the United box. Rooney looked like he might have sealed the result with a turn and shot but the ball stuck in the St James Park mud and Jones raced back to gather on the goalline. Moments later Devine had the chance to make himself a hero, but he could only volley Jeannin's brilliant cross wide of Howard's goal after being left unmarked six yards out. After Rooney had completely messed up a free-kick 20 yards out Taylor showed him how it should be done, his stunning drive from distance forcing a flying stop from Howard. The home crowd were baying for a goal and they did get the ball into the net only for Devine's low effort to be ruled out for an obvious offside. The persistent Rooney eventually rounded Jones with three minutes to go and slotted into an empty net to book a home tie with Middlesbrough in the fourth round.
 
 Jones, Hiley, Sawyer, Gaia, Jeannin, Moxey, Taylor (Martin 89), Ampadu (Afful 69), Clay, Flack (Edwards 74), Devine. Subs Not Used: Rice, Todd.
 
 Ampadu, Clay.
 
 Howard, Phil Neville, Gary Neville, O'Shea, Fortune, Giggs (Saha 70), Miller (Fletcher 66), Scholes, Djemba-Djemba (Silvestre 80), Ronaldo, Rooney. Subs Not Used: Ricardo, Bellion.
 
 Ronaldo 9, Rooney 87.
 
 9,033.
 
 P Dowd (Staffordshire).
llama3.2:1b:
Manchester United edged past Exeter City 2-1 in a replay of their FA Cup third round match after originally playing to a 0-0 draw. 

Cristiano Ronaldo scored the first goal for United with a one-timer, and Wayne Rooney sealed the win late on with a goal just before the end of stoppage time.
llama3.2:3b: Manchester United beat Exeter City 2-0 in the FA Cup third round replay, despite a strong Exeter performance and several great saves from goalkeeper Paul Jones. Cristiano Ronaldo scored the opener after just nine minutes, while Wayne Rooney sealed the win late on with a cool finish. Exeter had several chances, including two volleys by Sean Devine, but United's pressure eventually paid off as they secured a home tie in the fourth round.
gemma2:2b: Manchester United defeated Exeter City in a replay of their FA Cup third-round match. Cristiano Ronaldo scored the first goal, and Wayne Rooney sealed the win with a goal late in the game.  The Red Devils were unable to capitalize on numerous opportunities throughout the game, but ultimately secured a victory through Rooney's decisive finish.
qwen2.5:0.5b: Manchester United avoided an FA Cup upset by edging past Exeter City in their third round replay after Cristiano Ronaldo scored the opener and Wayne Rooney put the tie beyond doubt late on with a cool finish. Exeter began brightly but failed to make the most of the situation as they struggled for chances and Everton manager Sir Alex Ferguson handed starts to Paul Scholes, Ryan, and Ronaldo. The visitors' pressure was intense, and Rooney had another shot blocked while Cristiano Ronaldo slotted over the bar again from a good position. Just before the break Giggs had a golden chance to double the advantage but the Welshman dragged a left-foot effort badly wide from 10 yards. In stoppage time, Exeter created their best opportunity as Alex Jeannin swung in a cross from the left and Devine managed to flick it goalwards, but Howard forced a flying stop on Taylor's shot, resulting in a free-kick that Rooney made off the goalline. After Rooney had completely messed up his free-kick, Devine slotted into an empty net for his second goal of the game and booked Middlesbrough in the fourth round.
qwen2.5:1.5b: Manchester United defeated Exeter City in a replay of the FA Cup third round to advance to the fourth round against Middlesbrough. Cristiano Ronaldo scored the opening goal, and although United had several chances to secure victory, they fell short. Exeter threatened with two goals but failed to convert. Manchester United's win advances them to the next round.
qwen2.5:3b: Manchester United avoided an FA Cup upset by defeating Exeter City in their third round replay. Cristiano Ronaldo scored early for United after slipping the ball between Paul Jones' legs. Wayne Rooney sealed victory with a cool finish late on. Exeter created chances through Sean Devine and Andrew Taylor, but Tim Howard made key saves. Sir Alex Ferguson handed starts to Paul Scholes, Ryan Giggs, Ronaldo, and Rooney, who dominated possession early. The match remained goalless until the 86th minute when Cristiano Ronaldo scored from a close-range effort after rounding Jones. Exeter City's best chance came in stoppage time when Devine shot wide of Howard's goal. Final attendance was 9,033 with Paul Dowd as match referee.

smollm:1.7b: The Manchester United team was able to avoid a FA Cup upset by scoring a goal in the third round replay after Manchester City's defeat in the first round. The game saw Cristiano Ronaldo score the opener, slipping the ball between Jones' legs after just nine minutes of play. United were able to make it safe as they had chances of their own and could have made some great saves if they had been able to get them. Exeter City's defeat in the first round meant that Manchester United were able to avoid a FA Cup upset by scoring a goal in the third round replay.

tinyllama:1.1b:
In response to the FA Cup match between Manchester United and Exeter City in their third round replacement game, summarizing key ideas and details as plain text—no explanation or formatting. 

Manchester United avoided an FA Cup upset by edging past Exeter City in their third round replaey, scoring a first-half goal from Cristiano Ronaldo after just 9 minutes, securing a comfortable 1-0 victory at Old Trafford. Exeter City began brightly with Devine and Steve Flack seeing plenty of the ball but it was United who began to assert their authority in midfield, starting Chris Smalling in place of Wayne Rooney while Paul Scholes played a pass into Ronaldo's feet for his 20th-minute goal. Exeter City's pressure continued with a number of chances, including Devine's 36th-minute effort that went wide and Chris Iwelumo's close-range volley that was saved by Tim Howard, but United maintained their solidity to see out the rest of the half. In the second half, United saw further opportunities missed as Exeter began to dominate but Rooney had a chance to double his side's lead with a left-foot shot that went straight at goalkeeper Andy Jones before Ronaldo volleyed over from 10 yards after Devine had been fouled. With the remainder of the game in danger of ending goalless, United created their best opportunity of the tie as Alex Jeannin swung in a cross from the left that Flatman managed to flick goalwards but Jones managed to punch clear. United looked set for a late comeback when Exeter midfielder Andrew Taulli fouled Iwelumo, but Rooney managed to convert the resulting free-kick with his volley into an empty net, booking himself a home tie with Middleton in the fourth round of the FA Cup.
tinydolphin:1.1b: A summary of the match between Manchester United and Exeter City is as follows: In the third round of the FA Cup, Manchester United overcame a challenging Exeter City side with an impressive performance on the field. The key aspects of this match are: (1) Cristiano Ronaldo scoring a decisive goal for Manchester United, who secured a 1-0 victory against their relegation rivals; (2) Wayne Rooney's brilliant free-kick that sealed the game and sent Exeter on the defensive; (3) Paul Scholes' excellent performance, as he was consistently in the right place at the right time to aid the team's cause; (4) Ryan Giggs' outstanding defensive display, which saw him make a number of crucial interceptions and clearances to help maintain the lead for Manchester United. Overall, this match resulted in an important victory for Manchester United, demonstrating their ability to consistently overcome challenges on the field.
phi:2.7b: Manchester United defeated Exeter City 2-1 in a third round FA Cup replay to advance to the fourth round. Cristiano Ronaldo scored in the first half after passing the ball between Paul Jones' legs and Wayne Rooney added another goal for United with a cool finish. Although Exeter had chances to score, they were unable to match United's dominance on the day and ultimately lost 3-1.
orca-mini:3b: Manchester United beat Exeter City 2-0 in their third round FA Cup tie. Cristiano Ronaldo scored the opener and Wayne Rooney put the game beyond doubt with a late goal. Sir Alex Ferguson made changes to his starting XI, with Paul Scholes and Ryan coming into the team alongside Ronaldo and Rooney. Exeter began brightly but were soon behind after Scholes' pass found Ronaldo in the six-yard box, and he slotted past Jones. The visitors continued to pressure and Rooney had a golden chance to make it 2-0 but his shot went wide of the goal. Despite their dominance, United could not make it three without a late twist as Devine's low effort was ruled out for offside. In stoppage time, Exeter were awarded a free-kick from a rare attack but Taylor's stunning strike hit the crossbar and bounced away for a corner. With just three minutes left, Rooney completed the victory with a simple finish after Jones had saved from Scholes and Rooney.
hermes3:3b: Manchester United beat Exeter City in FA Cup third round replay, with Cristiano Ronaldo scoring the opening goal and Wayne Rooney completing the victory.
